item.title: Grade 4
item.description:
1. Intelligence Basics

  • What is Intelligence?
    • Understanding the concept of intelligence and what it means to be intelligent.
  • Human Intelligence
    • Exploring how humans think, learn, and solve problems.
  • Animal Intelligence
    • Examples of how animals display intelligence in their behaviors.

2. Brain and Computers

  • Human Senses
    • The five senses—sight, hearing, touch, taste, smell—that help us perceive the world.
  • Human Outputs
    • Ways we express ourselves through speaking, writing, and movement.
  • Human Brain
    • Introduction to how humans collect input through senses, process it, and provide output.
  • Basic Understanding of Computers
    • How computers take input, process information, and provide output.
  • AI Input
    • Formats in which AI systems receive information from the world.
  • AI Output
    • Formats in which AI systems provide results or actions based on input.

3. AI in Everyday Life

  • Introduction to AI
    • Basic understanding of what Artificial Intelligence is.
  • Existing AI Tools
    • Siri, Alexa, Google Assistant
      • Learning about voice assistants and how they assist us in daily tasks.
  • Recommendation Systems
    • Examples of recommendation systems like Netflix or Amazon.

4. Basic Usage of AI

  • What is a Prompt?
    • Learning how to ask questions or give instructions to AI.
  • What is Context?
    • Understanding what context means in a conversation with AI.

5. Popular AI Tools

  • ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude
    • Interacting with AI through conversation.

item.title: Grade 5
item.description:
1. Review of Grade 4 Topics

2. Intelligence Basics

  • Perception
    • Recognizing that humans interpret complex information from vision, hearing, and other senses.
  • Reasoning
    • Understanding that humans use thinking skills to solve problems in daily life.
  • Memory
    • Learning about how humans store and recall information for future use in reasoning and problem-solving.

3. Types of AI Tools

  • Conversational AI
    • Exploring AI chatbots and virtual assistants that can communicate with users.
  • Image Generation
    • Understanding that AI can create new images from data.
  • Audio Generation
    • Discovering that AI can produce sounds or music.
  • Video Generation
    • Learning that AI can create videos using algorithms.
  • Speech Generation
    • Understanding that AI can produce human-like speech and voices.

4. Popular AI Tools

  • DALL-E, Midjourney
    • Creating images using AI technology.
  • Eleven Labs, Murf AI
    • Creating or editing speech using AI technology.
  • Sora, Runway ML
    • Creating video clips using AI technology.

5. Using AI Tools

  • Prompt Refining
    • Learning to write effective prompts.
  • Conversational Iterative Prompting
    • Practicing how to achieve desired results by refining prompts during conversations with AI.

6. Safe and Fair AI

  • Unbiased
    • Ensuring AI treats all users fairly without discrimination.
  • Inclusive
    • Making AI accessible and useful for everyone.
  • Safe (Asimov’s 3 Laws of Robotics)
    • Understanding basic rules designed to keep AI beneficial and safe.

7. AI for Social Good

  • Accessibility
    • Exploring how AI helps people with disabilities overcome challenges.
  • Education for Everyone
    • Understanding ways AI makes learning accessible to all students.

item.title: Grade 6
item.description:
1. Review of Previous Topics

2. Brain and Computers

  • Human Nervous System (CNS/PNS)
    • Introduction to how humans collect input through senses, process it, and respond.
  • Procedural Logic vs. AI Programs
    • Understanding the difference between traditional computer programs and AI programs.

3. Applications of AI

  • Education
    • The role of AI in enhancing learning experiences.
  • Robots
    • Exploring how robots use AI to perform tasks.
  • Self-driving Cars
    • Understanding how AI enables cars to drive themselves.
  • Healthcare
    • Learning about AI’s role in medicine and improving patient care and inclusive access.

4. AI for Social Good

  • Real-time Translation
    • Learning that AI can instantly translate languages to connect people globally.
  • Healthcare Advancements
    • Discovering how AI contributes to disease detection, drug discovery, and inclusive healthcare.

5. Types of Problems AI Needs to Solve

  • Classification
    • Sorting items into different categories.
  • Clustering
    • Grouping similar data points without predefined categories.
  • Recommendation
    • Suggesting products or content based on user preferences.
  • Prediction
    • Using data to forecast future events.
  • Generation
    • Creating new content like text, images, or music.

6. Understanding of Data Types

  • Text
    • Understanding that AI can process and understand written words.
  • Images
    • Learning that AI can analyze pictures by interpreting pixels.

item.title: Grade 7
item.description:
1. Review of Previous Topics

2. AI Development Process

  • Data Collection
    • Gathering information that AI systems need to learn.
  • Data Pre-processing
    • Cleaning and organizing data for effective use.
  • Training
    • Teaching AI models using the prepared data.
  • Deployment
    • Making AI systems available for practical use.

3. Understanding of Data Types

  • Audio
    • Understanding that AI can interpret and process sound data.
  • Video
    • Learning that AI can analyze moving images or video frames.

4. Types of Problems AI Needs to Solve

  • Natural Language Understanding
    • Understanding that AI can comprehend human language.
  • Translation
    • Learning that AI can convert text or speech from one language to another.
  • Transliteration
    • Understanding that AI can convert text from one script to another.
  • Speech Recognition
    • Learning that AI can convert spoken language into text.
  • Speech Synthesis
    • Understanding that AI can convert text into spoken language.
  • Face Detection/Recognition
    • Discovering that AI can identify or verify a person from a digital image.

5. Safe and Fair AI

  • Accountability
    • Ensuring AI actions can be explained and are responsible.
  • AI and the Future of Work
    • Exploring potential changes in employment due to AI advancements.
  • AI Misuse
    • Weapons
      • Ethical concerns regarding AI in weaponry.
    • Surveillance
      • Balancing security needs with privacy rights.

item.title: Grade 9
item.description:
1. Review of Previous Topics

2. Understanding of Data Types

  • 3D Point Cloud
    • Learning about spatial data and how AI uses three-dimensional shapes.

3. Neural Network Training Basics

  • Dimensions of Input Data
    • Exploring how different types of data have various dimensions.
  • Types of Dataset
    • Understanding and dividing data into training, validation, and test sets.
  • Structure of Dataset
    • Learning how data is organized into features and labels for training.
  • Overfitting and Underfitting
    • Understanding the learning quality and generalization of neural networks.
  • Learning Rate
    • Learning about a parameter that determines the speed at which a model learns.

4. Types of Neural Networks

  • Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN)
    • AI models that generate new data resembling the training data.
  • Transformer
    • Advanced models for processing sequences, especially in language.
  • GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer)
    • Architecture behind advanced language models like ChatGPT.

5. NLP Basics

  • Parts-of-speech Tagging
    • Identifying grammatical parts of words in sentences.
  • Vectorization
    • Converting text into numerical vectors for processing.
  • Embeddings
    • Representing words in a way that captures their meanings and relationships.

6. Large Language Models

  • Retrieval Augmented Generation
    • Learning about enhancing AI responses using external data sources.
  • Zero-shot Prompting
    • Understanding how AI can perform tasks without prior specific training.
  • Fine Tuning
    • Learning about adjusting pre-trained models for specialized tasks.
  • LLM Parameters
    • Exploring settings like temperature, top_p, and top_k that control output randomness and creativity.

7. Use of AI in Robotics

  • Manipulation
    • Learning how robots handle and move objects.
  • Conversational Intelligence
    • Understanding that robots can engage in human-like dialogue.
  • Task Planning
    • Learning how robots plan and execute steps to achieve goals.

8. Limitations of LLM

  • Limited Reasoning
    • Recognizing challenges with complex problem-solving and logical reasoning.
  • Inability to Learn After Training
    • Understanding that AI models may not update knowledge in real-time after initial training.
  • Lack of Reverse Prompting
    • Learning about difficulties in adjusting context based on user feedback.

9. Types of Problems AI Needs to Solve

  • Time Series Forecasting
    • Predicting future data points based on past trends.
  • Pose Estimation
    • Determining the position and orientation of objects or body parts.
  • Gesture Recognition
    • Interpreting human gestures and movements.
  • Object Detection/Recognition/Segmentation
    • Identifying and isolating objects within images.
  • Anomaly/Outlier Detection
    • Finding unusual patterns that do not conform to expected behavior.
  • Weather Forecasting
    • Using AI to predict weather conditions.
  • Reasoning
    • Learning how AI solves problems through logical deduction and inference.

10. AI Development Process

  • In-depth Review
    • A comprehensive examination of each stage in developing AI systems.

11. Safe and Fair AI

  • Socially Beneficial
    • Ensuring AI contributes positively to society.
  • Accountability
    • Establishing responsibility for AI decisions and actions.
  • AI Misuse
    • Discussing ethical concerns, including AI in weapons and surveillance.
